paper.title: The many forms of a single fact

author.org: Hewlett Packard Labs., Palo Alto, CA, USA#TAB#

paper.abstract: Two categories of data interchange problems are generally recognized: differences in the representation of data items, and differences in the structural organization of records. There is a little-known intermediate problem: a simple fact can be presented in great variety of record formats. The author presents several dozen formats for representing one simple fact. u003e
